explanations.text: Maps are OCaml's associative arrays (also called hashmaps or dictionnaries). You can create a hashmap by specifying a module to use as a key type.
Adding a value to a map returns the [polymorphic variant](basics-variants.html) `` `Ok`` or `` `Duplicate`` (in which case the value already exists in the map).
To update a map, simply use the new map returned by `` `Ok`.
To update an already existing entry, you can use the `Map.set` method.
